author: Sharon Nunn
title: U.S. New Home Sales Fell in April
text:
WASHINGTON—Sales of new homes in the U.S. fell at the beginning of spring, reversing the stronger momentum seen in the first quarter.
Purchases of newly built single-family homes—a relatively narrow slice of all U.S. home sales—fell 1.5% to a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 662,000 in April, the Commerce Department said Wednesday. Economists surveyed by The Wall Street Journal had expected a larger 2.2% drop.
